relation: Displays IPv6 BGP routes matching the autonomous system path regular expression.
Displays routes matching the regular expression.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS IPv6 Command Reference - IPv6 Commands: show bgp ipv6 ne to show ipv6 cef sw [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {9716=This argument must be in the form documented in RFC 2373 where the address is specified in hexadecimal using 16-bit values between colons.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {235698=This command was introduced on Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers., 285335=This command was implemented on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers., 294516=To display the exact route for a specific GPRS Tunneling Protocol Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (GTP TEID), the port number for the destination port must be 2152., 218066=11000, 145572=This command was introduced on Cisco ASR 1000 Series devices., 225732=The ipv6-prefix must be in the form documented in RFC 2373 where the address is specified in hexadecimal using 16-bit values between colons. The prefix-length is a decimal value that indicates how many of the high-order contiguous bits of the address comprise the prefix (the network portion of the address). A slash mark must precede the decimal value.}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description regular-expression | dampened-routes ] [ received-routes | routes | flap-statistics | advertised-routes | paths [ipv6-address] neighbors { unicast | multicast } ipv6 bgp show To display information about IPv6 Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) connections to neighbors, use the show bgp ipv6 neighbors command in user EXEC or privileged EXEC mode. show bgp ipv6 neighbors show ipv6 cef switching statistics show ipv6 cef summary show ipv6 cef platform show ipv6 cef non-recursive show ipv6 cef neighbor discovery throttling show ipv6 cef exact-route show ipv6 cef events show ipv6 cef adjacency show ipv6 cef show ipv6 access-list show fm raguard show fm ipv6 traffic-filter show fm ipv6 pbr interface show fm ipv6 pbr all show erm statistics show bgp vpnv6 unicast show bgp ipv6 summary show bgp ipv6 route-map show bgp ipv6 regexp show bgp ipv6 quote-regexp show bgp ipv6 prefix-list show bgp ipv6 peer-group show bgp
textAfterTable: routes (Optional) Displays all routes received and accepted. This is a subset of the output from the received-routes keyword. flap-statistics (Optional) Displays flap statistics for the routes learned from the neighbor. advertised-routes (Optional) Displays all the routes the networking device advertised to the neighbor. paths regular-expression (Optional) Regular expression used to match the paths received. dampened-routes (Optional) Displays the dampened routes to the neighbor at the IP address specified. Command Modes User EXEC Privileged EXEC Command History Release Modification 12.2(2)T This
